intro: Crotalaria nitidula, commonly known as the glossy crotalaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and striking yellow flowers with distinctive black markings. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven leaflets, and it produces elongated pods that contain several seeds. Native to tropical regions, it is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
